alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg, southeastern Lunenburg and southwestern Brunswick Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Crosse, or near South Hill, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... South Hill, Lawrenceville, Brodnax, Brunswick, La Crosse, Ebony, Dundas, Bacons Fork, Cochran, Gills Corner, Beechwood, Bowens Corner, Meredithville, Forksville, Bracey, Eppes Fork, Palmer Springs, Ante, Barrows Store and John H Kerr Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
